examples: Now, like induction, abduction doesn’t give us certainty.
There's no certainty as to when.
Sputnik shatters certain American certainties and a sense of security.
Inductive arguments don’t provide you with certainty.
Because before taxes, the only certainty was death.
words.defineEn: the state of being sure about something, usually when there is proof
words.defineVi: trạng thái chắc chắn về điều gì đó, thường là khi có bằng chứng

examples: Maths error casts doubts on Greater Cambridge Partnership's road.
To raise doubts in people’s minds.
After a successful career at the Italian central bank, few people doubt his ability to whip the economy into shape.
A new study is casting doubt on the once popular narrative that N95 masks are more effective than surgical masks.
The referee gave him the benefit of the doubt.
words.defineEn: a feeling of uncertainty about something
words.defineVi: một cảm giác không chắc chắn về một cái gì đó

examples: The announcement only succeeded in creating confusion.

The group of students working on the assignment found that adding more people to the team only led to confusion and inefficiency, proving how two boys are half a boy, and three boys are no boy at all.
The company had two CEOs, but they quickly realized that when two ride together one must ride behind, and eventually appointed one as the clear leader to avoid confusion and conflicts.
Confusion about eligibility for loan forgiveness is widespread.
The confusion takes away some of your sense of control.
words.defineEn: a state of being confused and not having a clear understanding of an action, behavior, etc.
words.defineVi: một trạng thái bối rối và không hiểu rõ về một hành động, hành vi, v.v.

examples: He lost confidence and backed out of the deal at the last minute.
We have confidence in the police's ability to investigate and solve crimes.
Olivia shows her skin with confidence, wearing a swimsuit at the beach.
The performance improved as their confidence grew.
He clearly knew the game backward and forward and had confidence in his opinions.
words.defineEn: a feeling of hopefulness that derives from an optimistic attitude and mindset that allows one to see the bright side of things especially future events
words.defineVi: một cảm giác hy vọng bắt nguồn từ một thái độ và tư duy lạc quan cho phép một người nhìn thấy mặt tươi sáng của mọi thứ, đặc biệt là các sự kiện trong tương lai

examples: A post, which in all probability, is fake and written solely for either earning a brownie point or being afraid of left out.
Which light-absorbing molecule in which cone a particular photon hits, comes down to probability.
These numbers are probabilities.
Probability that this is a dog: 93%!
The probability is less than our significance level.
words.defineEn: how possible or likely something is to happen
words.defineVi: làm thế nào có thể hoặc có khả năng một cái gì đó sẽ xảy ra

examples: Scientists have already found probable candidates, too.
[Narrator] Some of the death certificates list probable COVID-19 as the cause of death, but tests were in short supply.
And he says that it’s simply more probable that God designed the world, than that it came about through the pure chance of evolutionary processes.
Klare says that Rank One's technology was misused in this case, because a match is not probable cause for arrest.
Another one of the probable functions of capsaicin was to keep organisms like us away.
words.defineEn: with a high possibility to happen or be true but not certain
words.defineVi: với khả năng xảy ra cao hoặc có thật nhưng không chắc chắn

examples: The suspects are in the wind.
One suspects that he is writing with tongue in cheek.
The police searched the suspect's house for evidence.
The suspect has been on the hook in the interrogation room for about 12 hours now.
I suspect the management is dragging its heels on this issue.
words.defineEn: to think that something is probably true, especially something bad, without having proof
words.defineVi: để nghĩ rằng một cái gì đó có lẽ là sự thật, đặc biệt là một cái gì đó xấu, mà không có bằng chứng

examples: I assure you.
I assure you that our company has opened our kimono about every aspect of our tax obligations to the state.
The customer service representative assured me that someone would be available to assist me shortly.
I assure you, ma'am, we will stop at nothing to catch that thief.
He felt a sense of relief when the doctor assured him that his stomach issue was temporary.
words.defineEn: to make someone sure about someone or something
words.defineVi: để làm cho ai đó chắc chắn về một ai đó hoặc một cái gì đó

examples: so I didn't hesitate.
She hesitated to touch the hot pan with her bare hands.
Never one to hesitate before shaking the plum tree for himself or his intimates.
Don't you dare hesitate Manfred!
The soldier knew that in combat, he who hesitates is lost, and so he trained rigorously to react quickly and decisively in any situation.
words.defineEn: to pause before saying or doing something because of uncertainty or nervousness
words.defineVi: tạm dừng trước khi nói hoặc làm điều gì đó vì không chắc chắn hoặc lo lắng

examples: There were hesitations, a gaffe, and one senior moment.
Despite his initial hesitation, John eventually decided to spill his guts out and share his deepest fears with his therapist.
They understand each other on a deep level and can confide in one another without hesitation.
The opportunity to study abroad came once in a lifetime, so she took it without hesitation.
And there's very little hesitation.
words.defineEn: the act of pausing before doing or saying something because one feels unsure
words.defineVi: hành động tạm dừng trước khi làm hoặc nói điều gì đó bởi vì một người cảm thấy không chắc chắn

examples: He has the courage of his convictions.
The conviction of the billionaire sends a message to the world that no one gets a free pass to break the law.
Lead your own life and have the courage of your convictions.
When we learned of the conviction, we dropped him like a hot potato.
George is a decent fella, it's just that he lacks the courage of his convictions.
words.defineEn: a belief or opinion that is very strong
words.defineVi: một niềm tin hoặc ý kiến đó là rất mạnh mẽ

examples: Not even the most talented athlete is guaranteed a long career.
Blue blood is no guarantee of any particular merit, competence, or expertise.
Winning one game does not guarantee success for the entire season.
If you leave your science project in my way, I can't guarantee I won't step on it!
The talented athlete has it made with a lucrative contract and sponsorships that guarantee their financial security.
words.defineEn: to make sure that something will occur
words.defineVi: để đảm bảo rằng một cái gì đó sẽ xảy ra

examples: A very extensive research and development programme ensures that we're ahead of the game.
She ensured that the lamb's lettuce received enough sunlight and water.
He always ensures that his outfit is impeccable, never a hair out of place.
The zookeepers took special care of the baby elephant, ensuring its healthy growth.
Harvesting abalone for culinary purposes requires sustainable practices to ensure the long-term survival of it.
words.defineEn: to make sure that something will happen
words.defineVi: để chắc chắn rằng một cái gì đó sẽ xảy ra

examples: Expecting eight guests all told.
Expect these changes to happen soon.
The company's new product launch is expected to do well in the market.
The novel was expected to sell between 1 000 and 1 500 copies.
Thousands of firms are expected to go to the wall this year.
words.defineEn: to think or believe that it is possible for something to happen or for someone to do something
words.defineVi: suy nghĩ hoặc tin rằng điều gì đó có thể xảy ra hoặc ai đó có thể làm điều gì đó

examples: Like all current theories of everything, that equation is speculative.
But speculative investing is ultra-risky.
Coffee intake was also down due to speculative links between caffeine and cancer, high cholesterol and other health diseases.
Well, most people are interested in bitcoin not as a currency, but a speculative investment.
As it stands now, they’re speculative explorations of mathematical models.
words.defineEn: according to opinions or guesses instead of facts
words.defineVi: theo ý kiến hoặc phỏng đoán thay vì sự thật

examples: Leave the concrete to set for a few hours.
The CEO gave a great speech about the company's commitment to social responsibility, but talk is cheap unless they start implementing concrete actions to reduce their carbon footprint.
So the concrete is inherently stronger.
The concrete industry uses about 3 trillion liters of water a year.
"The concrete evidence is right here."
words.defineEn: according to facts instead of opinions
words.defineVi: theo sự thật thay vì ý kiến

examples: Samuel couldn't help but give Helen the glad eye during the dinner party, showing his undeniable attraction to her.
The artist struggled with self-doubt, but his mentor reminded him that if he was born to be hanged, then he would never be drowned - his talent was undeniable, and he was destined for greatness.
His voice was undeniable.
- That's undeniable.
But Stacey's efforts made an undeniable impact.
words.defineEn: absolutely certain or true; unable to be denied or questioned
words.defineVi: hoàn toàn chắc chắn hoặc đúng; không thể bị từ chối hoặc đặt câu hỏi

examples: Well that's debatable.
Now, whether psychology today is considered a hard science or a social science or some other kind might be debatable.
So Tilly starts with the highly debatable proposition that war creates states, which then fight wars, which further enhance the power of states.
So which came first, the depression or your thoughts that might be debatable.
But the scientific reasons why hexagons seem to be everywhere are debatable.
words.defineEn: unclear or uncertain because of the involvement of many different opinions
words.defineVi: không rõ ràng hoặc không chắc chắn vì có nhiều ý kiến khác nhau

examples: From the moment the negotiations failed, the die was cast and war was inevitable.
Instead of whistling in the dark about the inevitable disaster, we should be making plans for when it strikes.
The team knew they were going to lose the game, so they resigned themselves to the inevitable defeat and played their best anyway.
Ecological disaster was inevitable.
That carbon-based life is inevitable?
words.defineEn: bound to happen in a way that is impossible to avoid or prevent
words.defineVi: nhất định xảy ra theo cách không thể tránh hoặc ngăn chặn

examples: The company is growing by leaps and bounds this year.
Even though she was fully aware of the risks, Susan refused to take the necessary precautions to prevent the spread of a contagious disease, proving that selfishness knows no bound.
It's bounded.
In 1529, another treaty set bounds for each country in the Indian Ocean and Pacific regions.
So the difference for Trump’s inauguration was leaps and bounds.
words.defineEn: likely to happen or sure to experience something
words.defineVi: có khả năng xảy ra hoặc chắc chắn để trải nghiệm một cái gì đó

examples: There is a tentative settlement.
And a month later, it takes its first tentative steps into the world.
And that tentative positive effect for mood disorders was also supported by findings from a 2016 meta-analysis.
It was a workhorse for large scale settlement of space, at a time when pioneers were still making tentative steps to explore space.
Just yesterday, Chicago and San Francisco, both involved in contentious battles, reached tentative agreements to reopen gradually.
words.defineEn: (of an agreement, etc.) indefinite or uncertain because one might make some changes to it in the future
words.defineVi: (của một thỏa thuận, v.v.) vô thời hạn hoặc không chắc chắn vì người ta có thể thực hiện một số thay đổi đối với nó trong tương lai

examples: He is convinced talk of a leadership challenge will come to nothing.
When I voted for him I was convinced he would win, but I backed the wrong horse!
Convinced I was.
Are you convinced?
But not everyone is convinced.
words.defineEn: having a strong belief in something or being certain about it
words.defineVi: có một niềm tin mạnh mẽ vào một cái gì đó hoặc chắc chắn về nó

examples: That DJ's voice really sets my teeth on edge.
The surgeon set her broken arm.
The scheme sets a precedent for other companies.
International companies set the price of oil.
His time in the 25-meter freestyle set a national record.
words.defineEn: prepared for something or to do something; likely to do something
words.defineVi: chuẩn bị cho một cái gì đó hoặc để làm một cái gì đó; có khả năng làm một cái gì đó

examples: The scientific evidence remains inconclusive as to whether human activities affect the global climate.
But so far, all scientific studies on the health benefits of coconut oil have been inconclusive, and nutritionists remain skeptical.
The big issue is that a lot of research into sensory deprivation is kind of inconclusive.
And the data's inconclusive when it comes to risk to humans.
Just to recap, the data around cops in schools keeping students safe is inconclusive.
words.defineEn: not producing a clear result or decision
words.defineVi: không tạo ra một kết quả hoặc quyết định rõ ràng

examples: This has their web FAI information on it presumably.
Presumably this would go somewhere else.
Presumably, it's costing your neighbor a fortune as well. -
So presumably, bigger Dimetrodons would need bigger sails.
And then presumably, there's also,
words.defineEn: used to say that the thing mentioned is based on an assumption
words.defineVi: được sử dụng để nói rằng điều được đề cập là dựa trên một giả định

examples: But then I assume you got the picture when we were there.
Many people assume that men are naturally better at sports, but time and time again, female athletes have proven that the gray mare is the better horse, often outperforming their male counterparts.
It was better than nothing I assume.
Don't get ahead of yourself and assume you'll win the competition without proper preparation.
He judged the book by its cover and assumed it wouldn't be interesting, but he was pleasantly surprised.
words.defineEn: to accept the truth of something without any proof
words.defineVi: để chấp nhận sự thật của một cái gì đó mà không cần bất kỳ bằng chứng

examples: She realized that her initial assumption was correct.
She is currently judging the book by its cover and making assumptions about its content.
The student who is not afraid to ask questions and challenge assumptions is more likely to gain a deeper understanding of the subject matter, as doubt is often the beginning of wisdom.
And then tweak your assumptions.
And, of course, scientists are always testing their assumptions.
words.defineEn: an idea or belief that one thinks is true without having a proof
words.defineVi: một ý tưởng hoặc niềm tin mà một người cho là đúng mà không có bằng chứng

examples: She had a decidedly down-at-heel appearance.
It is decidedly so.
Whales are a decidedly non-renewable resource.
I'm not interested in that with this plan, because this plan is decidedly not that.
This was one of the first times it’s really so effectively and decidedly directed at a Supreme Court nominee.
words.defineEn: in a way that is certain and beyond any doubt
words.defineVi: theo một cách chắc chắn và không còn nghi ngờ gì nữa

examples: Organic food is supposedly healthier more natural and more ethical.
Supposedly they all have their own strengths and weaknesses.
The president supposedly loved it.
Supposedly the battery is replaceable in this thing.
But this technology would supposedly require invasive surgery.
words.defineEn: based on what is believed or claimed not on facts
words.defineVi: dựa trên những gì được tin tưởng hoặc tuyên bố không dựa trên sự thật

examples: Her husband was doubtful about this.
I'm doubtful, unless she got a real strong arm.
To him, it seemed highly doubtful that the full-grown Coelophysis had swallowed such a large object in one piece.
now He then gets to go back to his doubtful mom and decree What can I say except you're welcome my five?

And isn't it true that art incorporates so much of the artist's experience that even if we are able to unlock biologically-enhanced creativity, it's doubtful that it would result in a surge of "super-art?"
words.defineEn: improbable or unlikely to happen or be the case
words.defineVi: không thể xảy ra hoặc không thể xảy ra hoặc là trường hợp

examples: I'm dubious.
That’s a dubious proposition.
Some anesthetics had been used for dubious recreation for centuries.
Exactly, everything else is dubious and slimy and-
There's been a lot of buzz about dubious chemicals in the environment that might contribute to some pretty frightening stuff like obesity, breast cancer, thyroid issues.
words.defineEn: likely to be dishonest
words.defineVi: có khả năng là không trung thực
